author: Stephanie Hallett
title: You need to see an emotional Andrew Garfield as Emma Stone accepts her first Oscar
text:
You need to see an emotional Andrew Garfield as Emma Stone accepts her first Oscar Today in ex-partner goals, Andrew Garfield proved once again that he adores Emma Stone and will support her always.
As Stone stood on stage to accept her award for Best Actress for La La Land , Garfield was spotted in the audience by eagle-eyed Twitterers who noted that Stone’s former paramour looked positively overwhelmed with pride — and may have even shed a few tears of joy over Stone’s success.
While thanking her friends, family, and colleagues for their support on her Hollywood journey, Stone was understandably choked up. And out in the audience, Garfield appeared to be as happy as ever for his one-time love.
#AndrewGarfield cried when #EmmaStone won her #Oscary2017 for #LaLaLand as Mia! in Los Angeles, (Feb. 26) pic.twitter.com/pck3GDzqHX 
— Andrew Garfield News (@AndrewGarfieldN) February 27, 2017 His reaction, honestly, isn’t super surprising (though we’ll never get tired of his sweet behavior!). When Stone won her Golden Globe for Best Actress earlier this year, Garfield gave her a standing ovation from the audience.
andrew garfield standing and clapping while emma stone walks to the stage to receive her award pic.twitter.com/aKOIblwqfs 
— best of stonefield (@stonefieldpost) January 9, 2017 Look for him on the far left of the video above!
And when he was asked by The Hollywood Reporter in December last year who’d he take to a desert island, he said unequivocally, “Emma Stone. I love Emma. She’s all right. She can come.”
Stone even made it a point to stop by and see her ex at the Oscars last night, reportedly interrupting Garfield as he chatted with his father to say hello and give him a squeeze.
A post shared by ♡ ѕтσnefield ♡ (@stonefield_love) on Feb 27, 2017 at 1:18pm PST 
Even if these little darlings never get back together, it’s nice to know that real, honest love exists in the world and even after a relationship is over, that love can remain. *Insert heart-eye emoji*
